example[0]: The cost of repairing the damage could run to $1 million.
definition[1]: to be or have enough money to pay for something
example[2]: Our budget won’t run to replacing all the computers.
definition[2]: to ask someone to help or protect you
example[3]: You can’t keep running to your parents every time you have a problem.
definition[3]: if someone’s taste runs to something, that is what they like
example[4]: His taste ran to action movies and thrillers.
example[5]: The damages awarded by the court could run to one billion pounds.
